Subjective: Dizziness for 3 days. Started suddenly upon waking. Room-spinning vertigo, worse with head movement. Accompanied by nausea but no vomiting. No headache, no hearing loss, no tinnitus, no speech issues, no focal weakness. Recent cold. No fever, no weight loss. Social: No smoking/drugs/alcohol. ICE (Concern): Fear of brain tumor (friend has brain tumor). Impact: Limits daily activities, unable to function normally.
Objective: BP: 110/70. HR: 62. Neurological exam: Cranial nerves intact. Strength normal. No nystagmus. HIT test negative bilaterally. Epley maneuver positive: provoked vertigo and nystagmus. No focal deficits.
Assessment: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV). Ruled out: Brain tumor, other central causes.
Plan: 1. Perform Epley maneuver in office. 2. Provide home instructions for recurrence. 3. Reassurance regarding benign nature. 4. Follow-up if no improvement or worsening symptoms.
